definition: robe of a Buddhist priest/ceremonial garment of a Daoist priest/robe of a judge, nun, priest etc/cassock/vestment
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Geoffrey reached beneath his frock and produced two pistols.
sentences.chinese: 傑弗裏伸向他的法衣內並掏出兩把手槍。

sentences.english: The judge was wearing a black cope.
sentences.chinese: 這位法官穿著一件黑色的法衣。

sentences.english: The priest wore a purple vestment to conduct the funeral services.
sentences.chinese: 牧師穿上紫色法衣主持葬禮儀式。

sentences.english: I took the shirt and hurried to the side of the dying Mute Singer.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起法衣，飛奔到奄奄一息的“沉默的歌手”身旁。

sentences.english: He wore a black soutane which gave him something of a courtly air.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着一身黑色的祭司法衣，顯得優雅高貴。

sentences.english: The beggar put on the white shirt, and gave me a candle to hold. Then he got down close to the Mute Singer and said
sentences.chinese: 乞丐穿上白色法衣，給我一隻蠟燭讓我握着。

sentences.english: Wearing cassock, a flamen was inspecting the detailed work in the sacrifice hall.
sentences.chinese: 祭司穿上法衣，到廟裏去察看祭堂的各項準備工作。

sentences.english: Wearing cassock , a flamen was inspecting the detailed work in the sacrifice hall.
sentences.chinese: 祭司穿上法衣，到廟裏去察看祭堂的各項準備工作。

definition: kasaya, a patchwork outer vestment worn by a Buddhist monk
purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position
the Eternal Wheel of life in Buddhism
the staff of a Buddhist monk
